addStableSwapPool((uint32,bytes32),addre.details: Must pass in the _canonical information so it can be emitted in event

params._canonical: - The canonical id and domain to remove

params._key: - The hash of the canonical id and domain to remove (mapping key)

setupAsset((uint32,bytes32),uint8,string.details: When whitelisting the canonical asset, all representational assets would be whitelisted as well. In the event you have a different adopted asset (i.e. PoS USDC on polygon), you should *not* whitelist the adopted asset. The stable swap pool address used should allow you to swap between the local <> adopted asset.

params._adoptedAssetId: - The used asset id for this domain (e.g. PoS USDC for polygon)
params._canonical: - The canonical asset to add by id and domain. All representations will be whitelisted as well
params._stableSwapPool: - The address of the local stableswap pool, if it exists.

params._canonical: - The canonical id and domain to remove

updateLiquidityCap((uint32,bytes32),uint.details: Must pass in the _canonical information so it can be emitted in event

AssetAdded(bytes32,bytes32,uint32,addres.notice: Emitted when a new asset is added

AssetRemoved(bytes32,address).notice: Emitted when an asset is removed from whitelists

LiquidityCapUpdated(bytes32,bytes32,uint.notice: Emitted when a liquidity cap is updated

StableSwapAdded(bytes32,bytes32,uint32,a.notice: Emitted when a new stable-swap AMM is added for the local <> adopted token

TokenDeployed(uint32,bytes32,address).notice: emitted when a representation token contract is deployed

addStableSwapPool((uint32,bytes32),addre.notice: Adds a stable swap pool for the local <> adopted asset.

removeAssetId((uint32,bytes32),address,a.notice: Used to remove assets from the whitelist

removeAssetId(bytes32,address,address).notice: Used to remove assets from the whitelist

setupAsset((uint32,bytes32),uint8,string.notice: Used to add supported assets. This is an admin only function

updateDetails((uint32,bytes32),string,st.notice: Used to update the name and symbol of a local token

updateLiquidityCap((uint32,bytes32),uint.notice: Adds a stable swap pool for the local <> adopted asset.
